quest.name: Lunar Conspiracy
journal: Nashu Mhakaracca awaits your approach, like a butterfly poised to set off a hurricane.

In full knowledge of the fact that hijinks of subjective hilarity will ensue, you engage Nashu in conversation, who proceeds to regale you with her theory that Inspector Hildibrand has, in fact, been spirited away to the moon─a lead she attributes to the quote-unquote journalism of The Thavnairian Truth. Hoping to follow in the footsteps of Dorian, the editor in chief, as he chases his story into the heavens above, the irrepressible Nashu insists that you accompany her to Garlemald and its not-so-secret lunar portal.

After arriving in Camp Broken Glass, a shivering Nashu asks for the location of the portal in question. She trudges off in the direction of the Tower of Babil, and once again, in contravention of common sense, you feel compelled to follow.

In the Enceladeum you come upon an exasperated Delion attempting to convince the gatekeeper to allow him passage. Although you make no particular attempt to vouch for his character, the guard decides that Delion is sufficiently enmeshed in your efforts to find the abducted Hildibrand that special dispensation is warranted. Lucky you. Your party, now a mismatched trio, is free to proceed through the Nethergate...

While Nashu admires the shiny white and decidedly inedible surface of the moon, Delion spies what he declares a “forward base.” You follow the alien-obsessed editor into the building, only to find him not-quite-speechless at the sight of the watcher and a visiting Loporrit. Although rightfully concerned by Delion's conspiracy-laden outbursts, the Loporrit nevertheless agrees to escort you to Bestways Burrow, where you can continue to gather information on the inspector's possible whereabouts.

Delion is, for a few blessed moments, stricken dumb by the sight of the burrow's expansive facilities. Alas, he recovers in time to join you and Nashu in questioning the local Loporrits.

※You must be accompanied by Nashu and Delion to complete this task. Speak with either of them again should you become separated.

You interrogate a languid Loporrit, but learn nothing of value. Perhaps another of his brethren has more information to share.

※You must be accompanied by Nashu and Delion to complete this task. Speak with either of them again should you become separated.

The Loporrit promoter has seen many an unusual visitor...but none of them appear to have been the inspector. Third bunny's the charm?

※You must be accompanied by Nashu and Delion to complete this task. Speak with either of them again should you become separated.

Weavingway has no recollection of a gentleman in ragged clothes, but did spot an unidentified object flying in the south of Mare Lamentorum. As the incessant theorizing of Delion fades into background noise, you head outside to follow this most promising lead.

You catch sight of your shiny quarry and race off in pursuit, only stopping when you find a familiar pair of legs sticking up out of the ground. Then you spot another pair. And another. As if someone had sowed a field of inverted gentlemen. The Hildibrands free themselves, and, following a brief festival of masculinity, the alien vessel returns to reap the Mandervillian harvest─with extreme prejudice. Thankfully, the original Hildibrand is returned to you unharmed shortly thereafter by the craft's pilot─a short, blue, bipedal creature introduced to you as “Master PuPu.” Through the inspector's explanation and the impeccable timing of the Echo, you piece together the extraterrestrial's story, learning that PuPu has come from a distant star in search of his own missing comrade. In words that lean dangerously close to becoming a catchphrase, the impassioned Inspector Hildibrand vows to solve this latest case.

Your ability to communicate with PuPu has earned you the admiration of Hildibrand...and the unnerving attentions of Delion. If naught else, the new case in which you find yourself embroiled promises to be equal parts eventful and ludicrous indeed.
objectives: Speak with Nashu at Camp Broken Glass.
Speak with Nashu at Sinus Lacrimarum.
Speak with Nashu and have her accompany you.
Gather information while Nashu and Delion are accompanying you.
Gather more information while Nashu and Delion are accompanying you.
Gather even more information while Nashu and Delion are accompanying you.
Search for the alien craft from the vantage point.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Forename, I have a new lead! And, just as I promised, you're the first to know!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Before we get into the details, though, I should give you back your soul container.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: I gave it a good scrub first, of course. Being the gentleman that he is, I'm sure the inspector wouldn't want to leave any lingering spiritual odors.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: There. Now you can listen to my findings without having distracting thoughts like, “When is Nashu going to give me back my soul container?”

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Now, as for the lead I mentioned─I was thumbing through a periodical and found an article on “alien abduction”!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: The way it was described was almost exactly what happened to the inspector...it even had a little diagram of a man swimming in midair. Anyway, the author seemed convinced that the victim had been taken to the moon!

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: This crackpot theory sounds awfully familiar...

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Why does this sound like the kind of rubbish The Thavnairian Truth publishes...?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: That's because it is! You remember Dorian, the editor in briefs? He was the one who wrote it!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: And he plans on doing research for the next edition on the moon itself. Apparently there's a portal or something in Garlemald that will take you straight there?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Oh, but a world-hopping adventurer like you must've been to the moon already! Know it like the back of your hand, I bet?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: I thought so! It'll be nice to have an expert guide up there to help me search for clues. What say you?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: To the moon, Nashu!

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: We shouldn't be so quick to trust the nonsensical ramblings of a man who sees aliens in every shadow.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: But an alien did steal away the inspector, just like Dorian said! I, for one, have faith in his journalistic intensity.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: And even if it wasn't an alien, that funny little ship did look like it was heading moonwards. Wouldn't you agree?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Right! I'll start packing my bags!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: I don't know what the weather is like on the moon, but I remember Garlemald being a bit chilly the last time I was there...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Oh, it's m-much, much colder than I r-remembered. I sure hope this lunar gate is close...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: The “Tower of Babble”? You mean that big, spiky spire?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Well, we definitely shouldn't get lost on the way there! Let's get moving!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: So, uh, this thing'll send us up to the moon, just like that? Courage, Nashu...

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: (-???-)The world is in grave danger and the people deserve to know! I have to reach the moon so I can expose the truth!

dialogue.name: LENTESTEARSGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: As I have explained to you twice already, I can only allow passage to authorized travelers. Which you are not.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Ah! You're with them, aren't you!? The aliens have infiltrated every layer of our society...

dialogue.name: LENTESTEARSGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: What in blazes are you talking about? I'm Dalmascan, born and raised...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Oh, look! It's Dorian! The editor in briefs!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: That's “Delion, editor in chief,” thank you very much. And you were friends of the abducted, I believe...?

dialogue.name: LENTESTEARSGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: Forename, greetings. Are you acquainted with this man, by any chance?

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: He exposited in my direction. Once.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: No, nor am I affiliated with him in any way, shape, or form.

dialogue.name: LENTESTEARSGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: And that was enough, I'd wager. He has “trouble” written all over him...

dialogue.name: LENTESTEARSGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: I wouldn't think so. He doesn't seem the kind of company a hero like you would keep...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: But, Forename, aren't you forgetting that whole conversation we had with Dorian back in Radz–at–Han?

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Forename? As in Forename Surname─Slayer of Gods, Savior of Ishgard, Liberator of the Provinces, Stealer of Pants!? How did I fail to recognize such an unbelievably famous individual!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: As a champion of the people, you have a duty to lead us through this fact-strangling checkpoint! We cannot let your comrade's abduction go unsolved! He needs you! And the world needs my next article!

dialogue.name: LENTESTEARSGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: ...And you believe he was taken to the moon?

dialogue.name: LENTESTEARSGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: Well, that certainly sounds like an emergency to me! Your “acquaintance” here seems sincere in his desire to help, so I will grant him special dispensation to accompany you just this once. You may proceed to the Nethergate.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Mysterious forces have thrust us together, and though I trust the fates about as much as I trust that obviously compromised gate guard, I will leave no moonstone unturned. The truth is up there!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Is...is this it? Are we here?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Oooh, the moon is just as white and shiny up close. <sniff> <sniff> But not made of cheese. And no sign of Inspector Hildibrand either...

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: So...we've already arrived!? The Empire's technology is more advanced than I feared...

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: <gasp> Over there! The aliens have built some kind of forward base on the lunar surface! We must sneak in and blow the lid on their invasion plans...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Looks like Dorian has a lead. Come on, we should follow him.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Aliens! Honest-to-gods aliens! I never expected them to be so tall...or so small and bunny-like...

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Welcome. If I had known I was receiving so many visitors, I would have sent for more tea...

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: That voice...speaking inside my head... I don't know the words, but their meaning is clear... Are...are they wielding psychic powers to try and brainwash me!?

dialogue.name: GENTLELOPORRIT
dialogue.text: You all right there, friend? Need help with anything in particular?

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: And this one speaks our tongue fluently! Learned it from your Sharlayan collaborators, I'll wager. Don't think you'll fool me, what with your adorable bunny nose and silken ears! I'll print the truth before you arrive to beguile my fellow men!

dialogue.name: GENTLELOPORRIT
dialogue.text: You're one of Urianger's friends, aren't you? I'm not sure who or what put such odd ideas into your companion's head, but would you mind setting him straight for me...?

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: The Loporrits are not alien invaders...although their adorableness does belie their capacity for shenanigans.

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: The Loporrits are allies of all mankind─misguided attempts to make us live off carrots alone notwithstanding.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: <gasp> They got to you, didn't they!?

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: I suppose I shouldn't be surprised─I've heard the rumors about the “disbanded” Scions of the Seventh Dawn. The formerly secret society has in truth become all the more secret, that it may pull our leaders' strings from the shadows...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Hold it right there, mister! I won't stand here and listen to you slander Forename or this lovely bunny any longer. You better not libel them neither!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: We actually came in search of Inspector Hildibrand, a dashing gentleman who we think was brought here by a shiny flying saucer. You wouldn't happen to have seen either of them around here, would you?

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: I am afraid I have seen neither. Long was it my duty to keep watch, but as the need for constant vigilance has since ended, I have grown accustomed to idleness. It's rather refreshing, really. Anyway, perhaps the Loporrits may have observed this man or his abductor...?

dialogue.name: GENTLELOPORRIT
dialogue.text: Hmm, I feel I would've remembered if I had. The others might have seen something, though.

dialogue.name: GENTLELOPORRIT
dialogue.text: Why don't I take you over to Bestways Burrow, and you can ask them about it yourself?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: That sounds like a wonderful idea! Please, lead the way!

dialogue.name: GENTLELOPORRIT
dialogue.text: If nothing else, getting an eyeful of the facilities we built for the benefit of mankind should help reassure your suspicious friend there.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Good gods...

dialogue.name: GENTLELOPORRIT
dialogue.text: I knew it. Seeing the burrow in all its magnificence has left your friend speechless.

dialogue.name: LOPORRITA04641
dialogue.text: I think I might go for a nice stroll through the trees...

dialogue.name: LOPORRITB04641
dialogue.text: Hm? An adventurer? If you're in search of excitement, then do we have the perfect place for you!

dialogue.name: WEAVINGWAY
dialogue.text: Oh, I like your style. In fact, this gives me an idea for a whole new line of Loporrit leisurewear.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: So. Many. Bunnies!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: If they can build a forward base on this scale, then what hope does mankind have against them...?

dialogue.name: GENTLELOPORRIT
dialogue.text: Oh, for the love of carrots, this is not a military operation! Do you see any cannons or assault craft? We haven't any weaponry at all.

dialogue.name: GENTLELOPORRIT
dialogue.text: Take your time, and chat with whomever you like. As for me, I've got perfectly innocuous and not-at-all nefarious things to do. Bye now!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Right, then! Let's get on with the investigation!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Nashu and Delion are now accompanying you. Keep them at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can leave your quest companions behind by entering a different area, or by speaking with them and selecting the option to part ways.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If you wish to have your companions join you again, return and speak with them at the original location.

dialogue.name: LOPORRITA04641
dialogue.text: Oh, I often stretch my legs out there under the stars, but can't say I've noticed anything out of the ordinary. Sorry.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Not to worry, we'll try our luck elsewhere. Thank you!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Furry-faced liars, the lot of them. They're probably hiding an entire fleet of alien attack craft...

dialogue.name: Q6
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Talk.

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Part ways.

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Oooh, I just want to nibble on their fuzzy widdle ears.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: I'm taking notes on everything in this base: floor plans, personnel, abstract tree structures. My next issue will expose their entire operation!

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Discuss the aetheryte.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Look! They even have an aetheryte here!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: An aetheryte? A convenient tool for meeting with their Sharlayan co-conspirators, no doubt.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Oh, they'll tell you aetherytes were an Allagan invention, but it was really just one of many alien technological secrets received in exchange for their undying loyalty.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Linkpearls, too. Be careful what you say on those “private” calls─the Sharlayans are always listening.

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Discuss the machinery beneath the floor.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Cor, that's a big fan. It must get hot in here.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: A propulsion engine...? Of course! This is no mere moon!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: You know the satellite upon which we stand was never a “natural” celestial body, right? It was a grand fabrication of the ancients.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: They were in contact with aliens even back then, but the purpose of their ambitious construction has eluded us...until now. It's obvious that the moon is a colossal starfaring vessel!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Are you sure you wish to part ways with your companions?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: You have a case more important than this one? All right, we'll suspend the investigation until you get back!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: I understand: being confronted with evidence of the uncanny can be unsettling to say the least. Take the time to adjust your thinking, then rejoin us where we came in.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: All solved and sorted? Great, let's reopen our investigation here!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Are you prepared to accept your new reality? Then let us proceed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must be accompanied by Nashu and Delion, and have them at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Nashu and Delion have yet to arrive. Be sure they are at your side before attempting to continue.

dialogue.name: LOPORRITA04641
dialogue.text: Did that man call me a furry-faced liar? I must have heard him wrong...

dialogue.name: LOPORRITB04641
dialogue.text: Oh, ever since we built the Excitatron 6000, we get all kinds of people around here! Could you describe your missing friend in a bit more detail?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Well, he's very gentlemanly and dapper...if you look past the almost-certainly tattered state of his clothing.

dialogue.name: LOPORRITB04641
dialogue.text: Hmmm...though their fashion sense can be a bit eclectic, our visiting adventurers are always dressed impeccably. Not to be rude, but I've a feeling your friend would have stood out in that crowd...

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: He's probably strapped to a table somewhere, even as we speak. Enduring unspeakable experiments... <shudder>

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: From what I've pieced together so far, the giant alien is the master. And all these smaller “xeno-bunnies” are artificial life-forms, created to serve as minions in his armies.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Their harmless appearance is part of the strategy. As soon as you let your guard down...snap! They take you down like a pack of tiny herbivorous wolves.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Dorian has some interesting theories, doesn't he? Being nibbled to death by a mob of cuddly bunnies doesn't sound like a bad way to go...

dialogue.name: LOPORRITB04641
dialogue.text: Once you find your friend, you should all come back and give the Excitatron a whirl! I guarantee you'll love it 6000!

dialogue.name: WEAVINGWAY
dialogue.text: ...No gentleman in ragged clothes, I'm afraid, but I did spot an object in flight that I couldn't immediately identify.

dialogue.name: WEAVINGWAY
dialogue.text: It was while I was out gathering materials, in the south of Mare Lamentorum. I presumed it was just some Allagan relic or new species of floating jellyfish, and didn't think too much of it.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Cor, now that sounds promising! Thank you for your time!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: What's this, then? A pod for growing new xeno-bunnies? They must plan to produce them in the millions, and overwhelm us with sheer fuzzy numbers...

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Ah! How could I have been so blind! Those aren't ears...they're psychic wave generators! They lure people close with their precious little faces, and then bam! Brainwashed!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: I've figured it all out, alien scum! And once the world reads my special edition, your dreams of domination will be done for! Hah!

dialogue.name: WEAVINGWAY
dialogue.text: What a strange and oddly aggravating man. Is he a friend of yours, too?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: He thinks he's a friend to the people, but I don't think any people are his friends.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Right! Let's get out there and find that flying object! ...Do you know which direction is “south”?

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Wait, I'm coming with you! Don't leave me alone with the brainwashing xeno-bunnies!

dialogue.name: WEAVINGWAY
dialogue.text: I'm not sure how to describe what I saw, but you'll know it when you see it.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: So many stars...like a million twinkling teeth in a great big gentlemanly smile. <sigh> We have to find him, Forename.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: How could you leave me behind!? Surely you know the first rule of alien hunting is “never split the party”?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Search for the flying object. You may move the camera, as well as zoom in and out. Target a likely suspect and inspect it with [???] / [???].

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Ah! There it is!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: ...And there it goes! Come on─we can't let it get away!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: We did it, Forename─we found the inspector! Case closed!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Horrendous... Only aliens could subject a man to such a callous─and physically implausible─fate.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Um. Are my eyes playing tricks on me, or do you see a whole field of planted Hildibrands?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRANDA
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand?-)Well, well, what a delightful surprise to see you here. Wherever “here” happens to be...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRANDB
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand...?-)My, what an impressive specimen of a gentleman you are, good sir.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRANDA
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand?-)The same could be said of you, my good man!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRANDC
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand!?-)Is this an extemporaneous gentleman's club? If I may be so bold as to join you?

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: What in the name of the occult is happening here? Where did they all come from?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: They're phantom Hildibrands created by the refraction of starlight through swamp gas.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Could be they're Hildibrand clones grown in an alien laboratory's flesh vats.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Impostors, you mean? Don't worry─I know just how to find the real inspector!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRANDA
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrands-)Cease and desist, Nashu! Use your powers of deduction, not destruction!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Hmmm. They're all so authentic─and synchronized. I honestly can't tell the difference...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRANDA
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand?-)Well, look no further. For I am the one and only Hildibrand, agent of enquiry and inspector extraordinaire!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRANDB
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand...?-)The one and only? I believe that would be me, good sir.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRANDC
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand!?-)How odd. I think you will find that I am the original Hildibrand.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRANDD
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand???-)Oh, I am more than certain that I am Hildibrand!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRANDE
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand...!?-)As am I!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRANDA
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand?-)Could it be that we are all Hildibrand!?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRANDA
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand?-)How positively marvelous! I propose we celebrate this auspicious moment as only a mob of Manderville men can!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: What manner of waking nightmare is this?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Apologies for the confusion, my friends. I assure you that this time you stand in the presence of the inimitable Hildibrand Helidor Maximilian Manderville!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: And this diminutive blue chap here is my new associate, Master PuPu.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Another alien species!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: <gasp> Of course! You're building a clone army to invade our star, and what we stumbled upon was a field test!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I do not believe we've had the pleasure, my excitable fellow, but I promise you that the amicable Master PuPu has no desire to wage any clone wars.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Then...what's this all about? Are you telling me you weren't abducted?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: A simple misunderstanding...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Ohohoho, what a charming little rascal you are. An offshoot of the mandragora family, perchance?

dialogue.name: KOYOKOYO
dialogue.text: (-Little Blue Man-)PuPu. PuPuPuPu... PuPuPuPuPuPu...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Pu...Pu? Ah, I see! Pleased to make your acquaintance, Master PuPu!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Ahem, might I inquire as to our current whereabouts? I had but recently reunited with Nashu and Forename, and would greatly appreciate it if you could convey me back to my prior location...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand-)Splendid! Full speed ahead, my dear fellow!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand-)Steady on, now! This is not...what I had...in mind!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand-)My word! You've generated a veritable battalion of identical gentlemen!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand-)Surely the world could never safely contain so much pure Mandervillian magnificence! Could you perchance reverse the process?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand-)Oh gods, no, not like that...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: (-Hildibrand-)Mummyyyyyy!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: ...Thus, I have concluded that Master PuPu has no grasp of the common tongue, and his true intentions─while surely peaceable─remain woefully unclear.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: It was only through frenzied gestures that I managed to direct him back here and have him clean up our Manderville multiplicity incident.

dialogue.name: KOYOKOYO
dialogue.text: PuPu... I hail...PuPuPuPu...from a star...PuPu...a great distance from here.

dialogue.name: KOYOKOYO
dialogue.text: PuPu...I came in search of a friend, whose communications halted mid-exploration.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: All this way to aid a comrade in distress, you say!?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: The devotion. The determination. Your touching story has sunk its hooks into my heart!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Fear not, my blue-hued friend! For I, Hildibrand, agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire, have attached myself to this case like a stubborn barnacle on a kraken's behind!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I swear to you, here and now: I shall scour all of creation, from the deepest pit of the seven hells to the very pinnacle of the heavens, for the missing comrade that you so desperately seek!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Mister PuPu's eyes make me feel dizzy. Like swirls that go around and around and around and around...

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: An entirely new species of alien... The next issue of the Truth will need to be a special double edition.

dialogue.name: KOYOKOYO
dialogue.text: I am glad you are here to help ward off any more...PuPu...misunderstandings.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Tell me, Forename, how is it that you're able to understand Master PuPu's language?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: The power of “echoes”? Ah, you mean persistent repetition? It sounds similar to the Manderville art of parley.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: You're saying you have an extrasensory ability that allows communication with aliens? How fascinating. Yes, most fascinating indeed...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Pending mysteries aside, I am glad indeed to once more be in the company of my faithful assistant and stalwart contemporary both!
